intro: Matelea uribei, commonly known as the Uribé's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Matelea uribei is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
